input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPOMActor

items The items XML that will be used to find messages.
Sample: --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- XML Sample of Find Message: <items> <item> <username>user</username> <password>pass</password> <arguments> <severity>Normal</severity> <dns-name>DnsName</dns-name> <category>Database</category> <application></application> <object>28835</object> <configuration-item></configuration-item> <correlation-key></correlation-key> <escalation-status></escalation-status> <condition-matched></condition-matched> <received-time comparator="at"></received-time> <state-change-time comparator="since">2h</state-change-time> <title comparator="contains">server</title> <custom-attributes> <custom-attribute> <key>Attribute</key> <text>text</text> </custom-attribute> </custom-attributes> <owner></owner> <life-cycle-state>open</life-cycle-state> <comparator></comparator> </arguments> </item> </items>
username[Optional] This username overrides the value specified in the config. password[Optional] This password overrides the value specified in the config.
arguments[Required] This is a list of arguments that is required for this operation
severity[Optional] Severity of the message. Possible values could be as follows :- - Normal - Warning - Minor - Major - Critical
dns-name[Optional] Specifies the DnsName (Node Name) of the message.
category[Optional] Specifies the category (Message Group) of the message.
application[Optional] Specifies Application of the message.
object[Optional] Specifies Object of the message.
configuration-item[Optional] Specifies configuration item of the message.
correlation-key[Optional] Specifies the correlation key of the message.
escalation-status[Optional] Specifies the escalation status of the message. Possible values could be as follows :- - notEscalated - Escalated
condition-matched[Optional] Specifies the condition matched of the message. Possible values could be as follows :- - true - false
received-time[Optional] Specifies the received time of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - at - - from - to - since Note : Received time should follow the following Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS When comparator "since" is used then the format should be xh or xd or xw where x is any valid number and h stands for hour(s), d stands for day(s) and w stands for week(s).
state-change-time[Optional] Specifies the state change time of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - at - - from - to - since Note : State change time should follow the following Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS When comparator "since" is used then the format should be xh or xd or xw where x is any valid number and h stands for hour(s), d stands for day(s) and w stands for week(s).
title[Optional] Specifies the Title of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - exactly - for exact match - contains - for contains
custom-attributes[Optional] Specifies the custom attribute of the message.
owner[Optional] Specifies the owner of the message. Possible values could be as follows :- - any - Specifies the message(es) owned by any anyone. - none - Specifies the message(es) not owned by anyone. - self - Specifies the message(es) owned by the current user. Current User will be the user specified at Request level else will be the user specified at adapter configuration. - others - Specifies the message(es) not owned by the current user.
life-cycle-state[Optional] Specifies the life cycle state of the message.
comparator[Optional] Specifies the comparision logic between the given parameters. Possible values for the comparator could be as follows :- - or - for using logical or between all the given parameters. - and - for using logical and between all the given parameters. It is the default value. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

documentation.description: Given some search criteria to find messages, get the data associated with those messages.
